snippet: The Rangers, who eliminated Pittsburgh on Tuesday night, will open the Eastern Conference finals on Saturday at Montreal.
abstract: New York Rangers, luxuriating in the afterglow of rallying from a three-games-to-one deficit to eliminate the Pittsburgh Penguins from the playoffs, are preparing for the Eastern Conference finals against Montreal Canadiens; since playoffs expanded beyond two rounds in 1968, no team has won the Stanley Cup after playing the maximum 14 games in the first two rounds; in Round 1, Rangers eliminated Philadelphia Flyers in Game 7.
lead_paragraph: The Rangers, who eliminated Pittsburgh on Tuesday night, will open the Eastern Conference finals on Saturday at Montreal.

headline.main: After Prevailing in Two Game 7s, Rangers Are Back at Square One
headline.print_headline: After Prevailing in Two Game 7s, Rangers Are Back at Square One
